ThingDef.label: dewback
ThingDef.description: Dewbacks are large, four-legged, omnivorous, cold-blooded reptiles native to the Dune Sea of Tatooine. As such, they are well-adapted to the harsh desert climate. This and the fact that they can be easily domesticated make them commonly employed as beasts of burden by both the inhabitants of the desert planet and the off-worlders wandering its dunes. Due to their numerous useful traits and versatility, they are quite possibly the most respected of all the creatures native to Tatooine.

ThingDef.label: rancor
ThingDef.description: Rancors are large semi-sentient reptilian carnivores native to the planet Dathomir. Standing around five meters tall, with their long arms, immense jaws, and armored hides that could withstand blaster fire, they are formidable predators. A subspecies known as the jungle rancor populates the planets Felucia and Teth.

ThingDef.label: bantha
ThingDef.description: Banthas are a species of large, hairy mammals with sharp, spiraling horns. They inhabit the desert planet Tatooine, though they are bred on many worlds throughout the galaxy. They are social herd animals, and are often domesticated, and used prominently, by Tusken Raiders as mounts and companionship.

ThingDef.label: nexu
ThingDef.description: Nexu's are agile predators with four red eyes and sharp quills. They have infrared vision and are 4.51 meters long. Typically 0.94 meters tall, nexus possess sharp teeth and claws, as well as long tails. It's light build allows it to remain highly agile and difficult to hit.

ThingDef.label: acklay
ThingDef.description: The acklay is a non-sentient carnivore native to Vendaxa. Acklays have sharp claws, thick skin, and are about 3 meters tall. Due to these attributes, as well as the species' ferocity, acklays are often exported from Vendaxa to be used in gladiatorial combat. The creatures can be found on Geonosis, where they are commonly brought in to fight other creatures—and sentients—in the Petranaki arena.

ThingDef.label: tauntaun
ThingDef.description: Tauntauns are a species of omnivorous reptomammals who are indigenous to the icy planet of Hoth. Tauntauns were commonly used as pack animals during the Rebel Alliance's stay at Hoth. Tauntauns were also used as patrol mounts when it was learned that the Rebel Alliance's own vehicles could not cope with the very cold weather.

ThingDef.label: krayt dragon
ThingDef.description: Krayt dragons are large, carnivorous reptiles from Tatooine, a desert planet in the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories. They come in two subspecies and, despite their fierceness, are hunted for the precious pearls found in their bodies.

ThingDef.label: reek
ThingDef.description: Reeks are large, muscular quadrupeds native to the planet Ylesia. Their sprawling posture and immense weight make them relatively slow-moving. They sport two large cheek horns that can be used for head-locking in combat with another Reek as a show of dominance.

ThingDef.label: nerf
ThingDef.description: Nerfs are quadrupedal creatures with curving horns and coarse, curly brown fur that covers their bodies. They are noted for their strong body odor, which humans regard as disgusting, and their bleats somewhat resemble the language used by the Aqualish people. Their mouths contain blunt teeth and a long pink tongue. They are herbivores, feeding on growing grass and herbage. Females of the species produce milk.

ThingDef.label: gizka
ThingDef.description: Whatever their native world, their extraordinary reproduction rate led to a fair amount of gizka on many worlds, even including uncharted planets such as Lehon, finding their way from the wreckage of crashed starships. It has been alternatively postulated that they came from that planet originally, spreading along with the Infinite Empire. Their exponential population growth led to them being considered pests on almost as many worlds as they inhabited, as they commonly ate electrical wiring. They were the source for the delicacy gizka steak.

ThingDef.label: porg
ThingDef.description: Porgs are a species of non-sentient birds. They are stocky in nature, with two short wings, flat, beak-less faces, and two webbed feet. Porgs are sexually dimorphic; males are slightly larger than females. Porgs of both sexes are covered in dense feathers, with white coloration on the body and face, and gray to brown on the wings and back. They are much lighter than they look, thanks to a thick outer layer of waterproof feathers with a fluffy underlayer for warmth. They can fly short distances but not far enough to leave their native island. They can also run quite swiftly on the ground and are good at maneuvering into small spaces. The birds have stereoscopic vision, colored with brown irises and black pupils. Porgs favor colder environments.

ThingDef.label: vulptex
ThingDef.description: The vulptices are a fox-like species of canids with a flexible body native to the mineral world Crait. Their most distinctive feature is a coat of crystaline bristles/spines that serve as protection against their predators. Their facial bristles (or whiskers) also help them gauge whether they can fit into a tight space. Vulptices have excellent low-light vision and keen senses. They are omnivorous.

ThingDef.label: Wampa
ThingDef.description: Wampa ice creatures are carnivorous predatory reptomammals indigenous to the remote Outer Rim Territories ice planet Hoth. The bipedal beasts stand over two meters in height with shaggy white fur constantly stained with the gore of slaughtered prey. Wampas are armed with jagged yellow teeth and deadly claws. Primarily solitary hunters, wampas occasionally hunt in packs, preferring to ambush their prey from the camouflage of Hoth's snow banks and blizzards. They are highly valued among big-game hunters for the challenge that comes with hunting the creatures, as well as for their pelts, stuffed heads, and other miscellaneous souvenirs that command high prices on the black market.

ThingDef.label: ronto
ThingDef.description: Ronto are large, quadruped mammals that are commonly used as beasts of burden by the Jawas of Tatooine. They are known for their loyalty and strength, being able to carry hundreds of kilograms of weight. They are large enough to frighten off Tusken Raiders, though they are easily spooked by machines, such as speeder bikes. They are commonly used on Nubia and Benja-Rihn.

ThingDef.label: frog-dog
ThingDef.description: Frog-dogs are a species of sentient reptiles with both frog-like and dog-like features. Each member of the species has a large cranium that sports two large, protruding eyes and long, pointed teeth that stick out from the mouth. Two squat limbs with five-fingered hands support the body. The body tapers to a long, thin tail. Frog-dogs catch insects and other prey with a long, sticky tongue that darts from the mouth and retrieves the desired meal. The creatures hop and waddle from place to place. Frog-dog vocalizations sound like throaty barks and croaks. Although they are both sentient and highly intelligent, frog-dogs are often mistaken for simple animals. A frog-dog might deign to live as the pet of another sentient being, for example, trading a life of denigration for a guaranteed source of food.
